intro: Dischidia balansae, commonly known as the creeping fig, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Dischidia balansae is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
